title: Starter Motor - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Battery Disconnect DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DWB; DVB; DVY; DX4; DW4; DW; DVX; DV

body.body: Battery - Removal DVY; DW; DW4; DX4; DWB; DVB

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DWB; DVB; DX4; DW4; DW; DVY

body.body: Starter Motor - Remove - DV; DVX; DVY; DW; DW4; DX4
Ease the rubber boot from the starter cable, release the nut and disconnect the cable.
Protect the crankcase painted surfaces from damage, using a suitable self-adhesive tape such as masking tape.
Release and discard the fixing securing the ignition switch bracket to the crankcase.
Release the two bolts securing the starter motor to the crankcase.
Damage to painted surfaces could result from inadequate care during removal or installation of the starter motor. Always protect the crankcase from damage during removal or installation.
Position the ignition switch to one side and carefully manoeuvre the starter motor out to the right hand side of the motorcycle.

metadata.ModelsTaxonomyLink: DVB; DWB; DX4; DW4; DW; DVY; DVX; DV
